messages.title: THE CHOICE
messages.content: Labour will secure the fragile recovery by protecting frontline services and refusing to make cuts to public investment too soon, as the Tories want to, making the cuts to public spending as a job and growth are back. Labour has invested billions in improving school buildings, with over 4,000 schools renovated since 1997. Locally, we have secured £150 million from the Government for this purpose.

messages.title: THE CHANGE
messages.content: Labour will restore the link between the state pension and earnings by 2012 at the latest, and the Tories had abolished the link between pension and earnings. Labour will extend the Child Trust Fund and Child Tax Credits and the Tories wanted to give the richest estates £200,000 inheritance tax cut.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will secure the fragile recovery by protecting frontline services and refusing to make cuts to public investment too soon.
Labour has invested billions in improving school buildings, with over 4,000 schools renovated since 1997.
Labour will restore the link between the state pension and earnings by 2012 at the latest and extend the Child Trust Fund and Child Tax Credits.
Labour wants to prevent the Tories from giving the richest estates a £200,000 inheritance tax cut.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The race is neck and neck between Labour and the Tories on Teesside.

quotes.text: IT'S YOUR FUTURE. VOTE FOR IT.
